title: [BUG] I got the error: "Something went wrong" when run MLflow inside a python virtual environment

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

2.1.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 20.04
- **Python version**: 3.8 


### Describe the problem


when I run MLflow on my local python environment (python 3.8) with the command:
` /home/my_username/.local/bin/mlflow ui --host 0.0.0.0 --backend-store-uri=sqlite:////home/my_username/mlflow.db  --default-artifact-root=/home/my_username/artifacts`
Everything works well.

But when I try to install and run MLflow inside a python virtual environment (python 3.8) with the command:
`/home/my_username/python_virtual_env_dir/bin/mlflow ui --host 0.0.0.0 --backend-store-uri=sqlite:////home/my_username/other_mlflow_dir/mlflow.db  --default-artifact-root=/home/my_username/other_mlflow_dir/artifacts` 


I got the error: "Something went wrong".
and where I check the console tab in chrome, I saw the API URL `/ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/experiments/list` return header 500 with content: 
`
{
  "error_code": "INTERNAL_ERROR",
  "message": "Detected out-of-date database schema (found version 97727af70f4d, but expected bd07f7e963c5). Take a backup of your database, then run 'mlflow db upgrade <database_uri>' to migrate your database to the latest schema. NOTE: schema migration may result in database downtime - please consult your database's documentation for more detail."
}`

i have run the command `/home/my_username/python_virtual_env_dir/bin/mlflow db upgrade sqlite:////home/my_username/other_mlflow_dir/mlflow.db` but the error is not resolve
 

 if I change the  `--backend-store-uri` to `file:////home/my_username/other_mlflow_dir/mlruns`, it's works, but I want to use SQLite and run MLflow inside a python virtual environment :(







### Steps to reproduce the bug

When access to localhost:5000

### Code to generate data required to reproduce the bug

_No response_

### Is the console panel in DevTools showing errors relevant to the bug?

_No response_

_No response_
